result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Davontae D Griffin

records.addlTxt:
9:39 AM Defendant Davontae D Griffin in court.  Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Davontae D Griffin.  Prosecuting attorney Lindsey Hirt in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case called for status of counsel.
Attorney Griffis has been appointed by the Public Defender's office. 
Defense is requesting some outstanding discovery and time to review with Defendant. 
State will request body cam footage Defense is seeking.
Hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.addlTxt: State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel - Atty Justin Griffis

10:30 AM Defendant Davontae D Griffin in court. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder.
Defendant qualifies for public defender representation.
Case is set over for status of counsel. 
Court confirms contact information for the Defendant.
Hearing scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow on 06/30/2022.
and Motion to Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key, filed by the District Attorney's Office.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.
Defendant to have no contact with Embassy Suites listed in the Criminal Complaint.

10:31 AM Defendant Davontae D Griffin in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court informs the State this case is missing a Victim Identification Key.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  The State may file a motion to modify conditions of bail once a victim identification key is filed but this Court is unable to identify who Victim A is at this time.  Hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
